name: Eyal Manor
title: GM, Google Cloud
description: Eyal is an EIR at Norwest Partners. Previously he was CPO at Twilio and GM of Google Cloud. At Google Eyal led a portfolio of products and technologies including Kubernetes, Istio, Billing, Cloud Functions, Marketplace, Monetization and other. In his previous roles with Google, Eyal led YouTube’s engineering teams, and prior to that spearheaded the development of Display Advertising products, including starting up Advertising Exchange and Real Time Bidding. Before joining Google, Eyal founded Voice and Video SaaS streaming startup and was in the IAF Research Group after graduating from Tel Aviv University.

name: Adam Fisher
title: Partner
description: Adam Fisher is widely regarded as one of the top investors in Israel with experience investing across the technology stack, from cutting edge hardware to consumer Internet. Always focused on product-oriented companies, among his many areas of interest is SMB focused SaaS, applications, and marketplaces (e.g. Yotpo, Melio, Hibob, Choco).

name: Adam Singolda
title: Founder & CEO
description: Adam Singolda is the founder and CEO of Taboola, a content discovery, and native advertising platform. With his experience in machine learning and data-driven technologies, Singolda has developed Taboola to be a leader in the field of content recommendation. His company reaches over a billion users monthly. Singolda has been an active contributor to industry thought leadership, speaking at technology conferences and writing for respected business publications. His entrepreneurial mindset and leadership skills enable him to drive continuous growth and innovation in the digital advertising industry.

name: Allon Bloch
title: Founder & CEO
description: Allon Bloch is an accomplished leader in the digital and tech industry, notable for his role as co-founder and CEO of K Health. He has previously served as CEO of Wix.com and Vroom, demonstrating a consistent track record in digital transformation and innovation. His entrepreneurial skill set, coupled with his deep understanding of the startup ecosystem, facilitates the successful execution of business strategies. A champion of tech-driven solutions, Bloch consistently prioritizes customer-centric approaches. He holds an MBA from Columbia Business School and a BSc in Physics and Computer Science from Bar-Ilan University.

name: Alon Matas
title: Founder & CEO
description: Alon Matas is the founder and CEO of BetterHelp, the leading online therapy platform. Alon has taken several online ventures through their entire life cycles: conceptualizing, planning, fundraising, team building, product design, development, launch, iteration, commercialization, optimization, growth, and eventually M&A. His passion is building, deploying, and scaling online services that solve real problems for real people. He is most excited by useful analytics, simple solutions, rapid execution, and working with people that care.

name: Amitay Kalmar
title: Founder & CEO
description:
Amitay is the co-founder and CEO of Lendbuzz. Previously, he was a vice president at Deutsche Bank’s Technology Investment Banking practice, where he worked with leading technology companies to successfully complete IPOs, debt financing, and M&A transactions. Amitay’s transaction experience includes SAP’s $8.3 billion acquisition of Concur Technologies; IBM’s $2 billion acquisition of Softlayer, SAP’s $1.4 billion acquisition of Hybris Software, Sungard, Paylocity, Eloqua and Bazaarvoice IPOs; and over twenty debt financing transactions. He also served as a Captain in the Israeli military, leading R&D teams developing digital communications systems.
Amitay earned a bachelor’s degree in computer science and mathematics from Tel-Aviv University; a master’s degree in computer science from the Interdisciplinary Center Herzliya in Tel Aviv; and an MBA from MIT Sloan School of Management.

name: Adi Tatarko
title: Founder & CEO
description: Adi Tatarko is the co-founder and CEO of Houzz, an online platform for home remodeling and design. Under her leadership, the company has become an influential marketplace in the design industry, connecting millions of homeowners with home professionals globally. Prior to founding Houzz, Tatarko worked in international finance. She holds a BA in Economics from Tel Aviv University. Adi’s entrepreneurial acumen and deep understanding of the technology-driven consumer market make her a valuable addition to any venture capital portfolio.

name: Amit Bendov
title: Founder & CEO
description: Amit Bendov is a seasoned entrepreneur in the tech industry, recognized for his leadership and strategic acumen. He co-founded Gong.io, where he currently serves as CEO. Prior to Gong.io, Amit was the CEO of SiSense, a business analytics company, and has held key positions at Panaya and ClickSoftware. His specialties encompass business intelligence, SaaS, and enterprise software. Through his direction and guidance, Bendov has cultivated growth and innovation in the companies he has led. He is widely acknowledged for his contributions to technology and leadership.

name: Amir Orad
title: CEO
description: Amir Orad is a serial CEO, entrepreneur, and Big data analytics, Cyber and FinTech thought leader. With a focus on building and scaling companies, Amir has led startups to become industry leaders with hundreds of millions in revenue and multiple M&As. Most recently Amir was the CEO of Sisense, a unicorn Business Analytics company simplifying complex data for business users. Prior to Sisense Orad was the CEO of NICE Actimize the financial crime and analytics leader monitoring billions of transactions at the world’s top institutions. Prior to Actimize, Orad was co-founder and EVP Product/CMO of Cyota, a cybersecurity and authentication cloud company protecting over 100 million online users, acquired by RSA Security for $145M. An industry pioneer, Amir is a thought leader in the application of big data and analytics in the FinTech and Cyber Security domains and often quoted in publications such as Wall Street Journal, The Guardian, Washington Post, CNBC, BBC etc.

name: Amir Zilberstein
title: Co-founder and Chairman
description: Amir Zilberstein is Managing Partner of Team8 Enterprise. Amir is also Chairman and Co-Founder of Claroty and a pioneer in the OT security market. Prior to Claroty, Amir co-founded Waterfall Security Solutions–a manufacturer of high-end security gateways for the critical infrastructure markets. Earlier, Amir co-founded Gita Technologies and prior to that, he managed a team of exceptional researchers and developers in an elite cyber unit of the Israeli Defense Force. Amir is the inventor and author of more than ten patents, most of which are in the field of cyber security. He holds a BSc and an MSc in Computer Sciences and Mathematics with Honors from Bar-Ilan University in Ramat Gan, Israel.

name: Eyal Shinar
title: Founder & CEO
description: Eyal Shinar is a seasoned entrepreneur and business leader best known for his role as the founder and CEO of Fundbox, a leading financial technology company that has revolutionized the way businesses manage their cash flow. With a background in strategic growth and operations, Shinar established Fundbox in 2013 with a vision to democratize access to credit for small businesses. Under his leadership, the company has grown exponentially, providing innovative solutions to help businesses bridge their short-term cash gaps. Prior to founding Fundbox, Shinar served in key positions at leading tech funds and companies such as Battery Ventures and Old Lane, a Citigroup company. Known for his expertise in leveraging technology to drive financial inclusion, Eyal Shinar continues to set the bar high in the fintech industry.

name: Eyal Gura
title: Founder & CEO
description: Eyal Gura is the Co-Founder and Chairman of Zebra Medical Vision, a next-generation medical imaging deep learning platform that will enable scalable diagnosis for the 1 billion people to join the middle class by 2020. Eyal is an Angel investor and venture capitalist with Pitango Venture Capital, the largest venture capital fund in the Middle East. Formerly, Co-Founder: PicScout (acquired by Getty Images); PicApp (acquired by Ybrant Digital); The Gifts Project (acquired by eBay). Adviser, WebTeb.com, the leading Arabic medical portal. Member, Advisory Board, Tmura.org. Member of the Board, Latet. Founding Member, Tovanotb.org. Eyal is a faculty member at IDC's Zell entrepreneurship program and a graduate of the Wharton Business School of the University of Pennsylvania. In 2014 Eyal was named a Young Global Leader by the World Economic Forum. Prior to earning his MBA from the Wharton Business school, Eyal graduated his BA with the Zell Entrepreneurship Program of IDC Herzliya, where he also Co-Founded the IEC (first entrepreneurship club in Israel) and now lectures about entrepreneurship and customer development.

name: Eran Shir
title: Founder & CEO
description: Eran Shir is a serial entrepreneur and investor, currently trying to change the world for the better at Nexar. Previously, he was Entrepreneur In Residence at Aleph, a VC out of Tel Aviv where he was focusing on fields like Internet of Things, big-data, cryptocurrencies, marketplaces and networks, and the way they disrupt important markets like healthcare, transportation, education, manufacturing, and finance. Before Aleph, he ran the global Creative Innovation Center for Yahoo!, where he was responsible for Yahoo!'s ad creative technologies strategy and portfolio, as well as the development of its next-generation ad creative personalization platform. He joined Yahoo! in Oct. 2010 when Yahoo! acquired Dapper, dynamic ads and semantic web startup he co-founded in 2007. In his past, Eran was a physicist, focusing primarily on complex systems and complex networks, and an Internet researcher, founder of the DIMES Internet research project, and Cogniview, a machine learning startup. He is passionate about building great products, teams, and companies that aim to change people's lives for the better.

name: Eran Gil
title: Founder & CEO
description:
Eran Gil has been the CEO of AllCloud since July of 2018 and a Board Member since 2015. As CEO, Eran is responsible for the overall leadership of AllCloud. He oversees the development of the company’s strategic vision and growth of the organization across the globe. 

An entrepreneur, board member, investor and adviser, Eran’s experience spans from senior leadership roles to CEO, most recently driving global sales and business development at Salesfusion. Prior, Eran co-founded Cloud Sherpas in 2008 and led various teams from global sales through global business development. Cloud Sherpas grew to over 1,100 employees and $200 million in annual sales, and was acquired by Accenture in 2015. 

Eran is also an active Board member of Algopix, Xertica and Enablo, all companies which operate in the cloud infrastructure and Software-as-a-Service space. Eran holds an MBA from the Goizueta Business School, Emory University in Atlanta.

name: Eldad Farkash
title: Founder & CEO
description: Eldad Farkash is the founder and CEO of Firebolt, a company dedicated to innovating data analytics through its Elastic Compute Infrastructure. With a history in data infrastructure, Farkash co-founded and served as CTO at Sisense before establishing Firebolt. His visionary leadership and comprehensive understanding of big data and business intelligence continue to guide Firebolt's mission to deliver high-speed analytics. Farkash's accomplishments exhibit his commitment to addressing complex data problems and his capacity to drive technological advancement in the data science industry.

name: Elad Walach
title: Founder & CEO
description: Elad Walach is a seasoned technology executive and AI expert. He co-founded Aidoc, a pioneer in radiology artificial intelligence, leveraging his extensive background in machine learning. With degrees in Computer Science and Physics from Tel Aviv University, he has honed his ability to innovate and drive technological advancements. Elad has contributed to several significant AI projects, delivering tangible healthcare improvements. A respected voice in AI, he is passionate about its potential in healthcare and continues to inspire others through his leadership and vision.

name: Elad Raz
title: Founder & CEO
description: As founder and CEO of NextSilicon, Elad Raz pioneered a radically new approach to HPC architecture that drives the industry forward by solving its biggest, most fundamental problems. With a rich background in computer science and entrepreneurship, Elad's vision is evident in NextSilicon's innovative products. His hands-on leadership style, coupled with a firm understanding of market needs, drives NextSilicon's continuous growth. Prior to founding NextSilicon, Elad held key positions in several tech startups, showcasing his abilities in strategic planning and team building. In addition to his business pursuits, Elad is an influential speaker, sharing insights on technological advancements and entrepreneurship.

name: Elad Gil
title: Founder & CEO
description:
Entrepreneur, operating executive, and investor or advisor to private companies such as AirBnB, Airtable, Anduril, Anchorage, Coinbase, dbt Labs, Deel, Figma, Flexport, Gitlab, Gusto, Instacart, Notion, Opendoor, OpenSea, PagerDuty, Pinterest, Retool, Rippling, Samsara, Square, Stripe, TripActions.

Co-Founder and Chairman at Color Genomics. Was CEO of Color from 2013 to fall 2016.
Previously, was the VP of Corporate Strategy at Twitter, as well as ran various product teams (Geo, Search). 

Joined Twitter via the acquisition of MixerLabs, a company was co-founder and CEO of. MixerLabs ran GeoAPI, one of the early developer-centric platform infrastructure products.

Spent many years at Google, where I started the mobile team and was involved in all aspects of getting the team up and running. Involved with 3 acquisitions (including the Android team) and was the original product manager for Google Mobile Maps and other key mobile products. 

Prior to Google, had product management and market seeding roles at a number of Silicon Valley companies. Also worked at McKinsey & Co. Received Ph.D. from MIT and have degrees in Mathematics and Biology from UCSD.

name: Dror Ginzberg
title: Founder & CEO
description: Dror was the co-founder and CEO of Wochit, the complete enterprise-grade solution for video creation in the cloud. Formerly he was co-founde er, GM and CTO of PicApp (Acquired by Ybrant Digital). Dror is a MAMRAM Alumni.

name: Doron Friedman
title: Founder
description: Doron Friedman is the seasoned founder and former CEO of SpotOn, a pioneering technology firm. Previously Doron was the CEO of just-in-time payment card pioneer Arroweye. An expert in tech innovation, his areas of focus include cloud computing, big data, and machine learning. Doron has a proven track record in transforming concepts into profitable businesses. His leadership style fosters innovation, drives growth, and instills customer-centric values. Doron holds a degree in Computer Science and Business, a testament to his comprehensive understanding of technology's commercial implications.

name: Dean Sysman
title: Founder & CEO
description: Dean is the founder and CEO of cybersecurity unicorn Axonius, an asset inventory management platform that focuses on cybersecurity solutions and policies. Prior to Axonius Dean was the founder and CTO of Cymmetria (Acq. by Stage Fund) and mentor at Techstars. Dean is a member of the Forbes Technology Council.

name: David Golan
title: Founder & CTO
description:
David is the co-founder, board director, and former CTO of Viz.ai, a digital healthcare company harnessing deep learning to analyze medical data and improve clinical workflow. Viz.ai developed the first ever FDA-approved AI-powered automatic triage system for stroke and is commercially installed in more than 800 hospitals across the US and Europe.
Prior to founding Viz.ai, David was a Fulbright postdoctoral scholar at Stanford University, working on leveraging deep learning for the analysis of medical imaging and genetic data. David holds a Ph.D. in Statistics and Machine learning from TAU and has co-authored more than 20 scientific papers including three publications in the journal Science. Prior to his academic career, David founded the ML team of b-hive Networks, an Israeli startup that was acquired by VMWare in 2008.

name: Eynat Guez
title: Founder & CEO
description: Eynat Guez is the accomplished founder and CEO of Papaya Global, an innovative global payroll and payment management platform. Her entrepreneurial drive, fueled by over a decade of experience in global HR and employment, led to the creation of a solution that simplifies international payroll complexities. Her previous ventures include co-founding Relocation Source and serving as VP Global HR at Addeco. Guez’s work at Papaya Global showcases her commitment to optimizing global workforce management and her belief in the power of technology to transform business operations. In addition to her professional work, Eynat is an outspoken leader of the movement to keep Israel a thriving democracy.

name: Guy Goldstein
title: Founder & CEO
description: Guy Goldstein is the co-founder and CEO of Next Insurance, a leading insurtech company transforming small business insurance. His extensive experience in entrepreneurship and technology-driven industries led him to co-establish the firm in 2016. Prior to Next Insurance, Goldstein co-founded and served as CEO of Check, a mobile payments company acquired by Intuit. His vision, leadership, and dedication to delivering comprehensive, affordable insurance solutions continue to drive Next Insurance's growth and impact in the small business ecosystem.

name: Hani Goldstein
title: Founder & CEO
description:
Hani Goldstein is the co-founder and CEO of Snappy, a company that helps organizations create connections through the power of gifting. Hani is a passionate entrepreneur who is driven by her desire to make a positive impact on the world.

She's been recognized for her work in entrepreneurship and innovation and featured in several publications, including Inc. Magazine and Business Wire.

name: Oren Zeev
title: Partner
description: Oren is the founder and managing partner of Zeev Ventures, the most successful one-man VC in history. Oren backs passionate founders building great companies, mostly in the internet and mobile internet spaces. He backed unicorns like Houzz, TripActions, Hippo, Next Insurance, Firebolt, Honeybook, Sunbit, Audible, Chegg and others who are redefining their respective industries. He is typically the main early investor and an active board member/chairman. He only invests in 1-2 new companies per year, typically Series A or Seed. His initial investment size is typically $5-10m but it has also been above and under this range. He sees his role as working for the companies and the CEOs he is privileged to serve. Oren is also the co-founder of fintech unicorn Tipalti

name: Oren Kaniel
title: Founder & CEO
description: Oren is the CEO & Co-Founder of AppsFlyer. Oren founded AppsFlyer to solve one of the major problems in the mobile apps market – mobile analytics and user attribution. Before founding AppsFlyer, he worked at Stage2 Ventures and held management and engineering positions at Veraz, Avaya and Intel. Oren holds a BA in Computer Science, Cum Laude, from the Technion, and an MBA from IDC, as part of an exchange with the Wharton Business School.

name: Joe Lonsdale
title: Partner
description: Joe Lonsdale is a technology entrepreneur and investor. He is the managing partner at 8VC, a US-based venture capital firm that manages several billion dollars in committed capital. He was an early institutional investor in notable technology startups, including Oculus (acq.FB), Guardant Health (NASDAQ: GH), Oscar (NYSE: OSCR), Illumio, Anduril, Wish (NASDAQ: WISH), JoyTunes, Blend (NASDAQ: BLND), and many others. Joe was the youngest member included in Forbes 100 Midas List in 2016 and 2017.

name: Ran Sarig
title: Founder & CEO
description: Ran Sarig is the founder and former CEO at Datorama a marketing intelligence platform that transforms the way marketers optimize their marketing performance. Datorama was acquired by Salesforce in 2018 for over $800M. Ran is a former VP R&D, Director of Program Management, and Product Manager at MediaMind.

name: Paul Bassat
title: Partner
description: Paul Bassat is a renowned Australian entrepreneur and investor. He co-founded the online job search website Seek Limited in 1997 with his brother Andrew Bassat, and took the company public in 2005 in a $587M IPO on the Australian Securities Exchange. Today the company is valued at over $6B. The brothers were co-CEOs until Paul resigned in 2011. Bassat is a Commissioner of the Australian Football League, a director of Wesfarmers Ltd, and co-founder of Square Peg Capital.

name: Ori Eisen
title: Founder & CEO
description: Founder and CEO, Trusona. Ori Eisen has spent the last twenty-two years in the cybersecurity and information technology industry, and is respected for his business knowledge and leadership. His background includes an in-depth application of innovative solutions for preventing online fraud. Prior to founding Trusona, Mr. Eisen was the Founder at 41st Parameter – the leading online fraud prevention and detection solution for financial institutions and e-commerce and travel merchants. 41st Parameter was acquired by Experian in 2013. Prior to 41st Parameter, Mr. Eisen served as the Worldwide Fraud Director for American Express focusing on Internet, MOTO and counterfeit fraud. During his tenure with American Express, Mr. Eisen championed the project to enhance the American Express authorization request to include Internet specific parameters. Prior to American Express, Mr. Eisen was the Director of Fraud Prevention for VeriSign/Network Solutions. By developing new and innovative technologies, he skillfully reduced fraud losses by over 85 percent in just three months. Mr. Eisen has an extensive background in developing system infrastructure and implemented solutions, and he is highly regarded in the information and payment technologies industry as a noted leader and technology innovator.

name: Ofer Smadari
title: Founder & CEO
description: Torq founder and CEO Ofer Smadari is an accomplished entrepreneur and business leader. He previously founded Luminate (Acq. by Symantec), which enabled security and IT teams to create Zero Trust Application Access architecture without traditional VPN appliances. Ofer is known for his innovative approach to problem-solving and his ability to build and lead high-performing teams.

name: Noam Bardin
title: Founder & CEO
description:
Noam Bardin is a highly accomplished technology company founder and CEO. He founded the ambitious Post.news social network to rebuild the lost connection between real people, real news, and civil conversation. Noam was previously the CEO of Waze, the world-renowned, community-driven navigation app. Under his guidance from 2009 until 2013, Waze experienced phenomenal growth, ultimately leading to its acquisition by Google for around $1 billion, marking one of the largest deals in Israel’s tech industry. Prior to Waze Noam was CEO of Intercast and co-founded Deltathree (NASDAQ: DDDC) a leading international VOIP service provider. 

Hailed as one of Business Insider's 100 Stars of Silicon Valley, he continues to inspire a generation of entrepreneurs and developers, ensuring technology serves as a catalyst for positive change and community development.

name: Ofer Vilenski
title: Founder & President
description: Co-founder of Bright Data, Jungo (acquired by NDS/Cisco), Hola (250m installs to date), Luminati (acquired by EMK Capital)

name: Oz Alon
title: Founder & CEO
description: Oz is an Israeli entrepreneur who founded HoneyBook, a financial management and workflow platform for freelancers and small businesses. He's a serial entrepreneur, having founded and sold several other companies before starting HoneyBook. He's passionate about using technology to make it easier for small businesses to succeed.

name: Ofer  Ben Noon
title: Founder & CEO
description: Ofer is co-founder and CEO of Talon Cyber Security, a leading provider of cyber security solutions for the distributed workforce. Prior to Talon, he was the founding CEO of Argus Cyber Security, the global leader in automotive cyber security, acquired by Continental in 2017. Ofer was named one of Israel’s “Top 30 under 30” by Forbes and was chosen by Wired Magazine for its shortlist of exciting individuals and groups. He is a former Captain in the IDF Cyber Intelligence Unit 8200, and a team member of two Israel Defense Prizes awarded projects. Ofer is an advisor and investor in a variety of startups and VCs.

name: Nir Erez
title: Founder & CEO
description: Erez co-founded Moovit with Roy Bick and Yaron Evron in February 2012 with the goal of simplifying urban mobility around the world. The company grew quickly with four rounds of funding totaling $133 million. Erez is a serial entrepreneur with over 20 years of experience leading technology startups. Prior to Moovit, Nir was also the founder and CEO of both ActionBase and Optimal Plus. Nir is also co-owner and co-founder of Eyron Group which invests in early-stage software companies.

name: Amir Amedi
title: Founder & CSO
description:
Remepy founder & Chief Science Officer Amir Amedi is an internationally acclaimed brain scientist with over 2 decades of experience in the field of brain plasticity and multisensory integration. He is a Professor in the School of Psychology in Reichman University, Israel and the founding director of The Baruch Ivcher Institute For Brain, Cognition & Technology & The Ruth and Meir Rosental Brain Imaging Center (MRI).

Amir’s background is multidisciplinary, with training in computational neuroscience (PhD 2005), brain imaging, neurology (visiting research fellow at NIH and Instructor of Neurology at Harvard Medical School), and music.

Amir is a world leader and one of the founding members of the IMRF.H e also wrote some of the most influential reviews and papers on the topic of Neuroplasticity, Brain imaging and rehab. Amir was elected as Fellow Visionaries as part of the Inspired by Einstein Genius100 Organization which include among the 100 visionaries 16 Nobel Prize winners.
 
His work has been featured in the NYT, Nature, Science, Washington Post, National Geographic Wired, New Scientist among others.

name: Aaron Jacobson
title: Partner
description:
Aaron Jacobson invests in entrepreneurs pioneering the next-generation of Cloud Apps, AI, DevOps, Cybersecurity, and Robotics. He serves as a board director or observer for Embrace, Rapid Robotics, Pulumi, Tigera, ForAllSecure, illusive networks, Streamsets, Built Robotics, and Juvo. He has also worked closely with many other NEA portfolio companies including Databricks, Box (NYSE:BOX), NGINX (acquired by F5), Bloom Energy (NYSE:BE), and Coursera (NYSE:COUR). In 2016 he was named to Forbes Magazine’s “30 Under 30” in Venture Capital and the Silicon Valley Business Journal's "40 Under 40".

Prior to joining NEA, Aaron spent two years at Qatalyst Partners in San Francisco. At Qatalyst, Aaron worked as an Analyst engaged in various M&A transactions, which included the sale of PopCap Games to Electronic Arts, the sale of Riot Games to Tencent, the strategic investment in Go Daddy from KKR / Silver Lake / TCV, the sale of Palm to HP, and Conexant's sale to Golden Gate Capital, among others.
Aaron graduated Summa Cum Laude from the Jerome Fisher Program in Management and Technology at the University of Pennsylvania, where he earned dual Bachelor of Science degrees in Economics and Electrical Engineering, and carried a minor in Math.

name: Aviram Shmueli
title: Founder & Chief Research & Innovation Officer
description:
I'm an 8200 and Israeli Ministry of Defense alumni with 20+ years of hands-on and senior managerial experience in engineering and product management organizations, driving innovation and execution in the cyber security and cloud computing domains.

I'm now working on Jit, an exciting venture I have founded with my 4 amazing partners. Jit's mission is to help developers adopt MVS (minimal viable security) and own security from day zero. Security should no longer be an afterthought or a tax for developers and their teams. It should be built into their products correctly and right from the start, improving by that the business velocity. Every high-velocity progressive developer organization will benefit from Jit.

name: Ariel Szklanny
title: Founder & CTO
description: Oshi CTO Ariel Szklanny obtained his Ph.D. in Tissue Engineering at Shulamit Levenberg's lab at the Technion, in which he specialized in 3D printing cells and biomaterials to create vascularized tissues. During his Ph.D., Ariel authored or co-authored nine papers, many of those published in high-impact journals. Previously, Ariel obtained his Biomedical Engineering degree at the National University of Entre Ríos in Argentina, in which he wrote his thesis on designing a polymeric droplets generator device for the medical industry.

name: David Politis
title: Founder & CEO
description: David Politis is the founder and CEO of BetterCloud, the first provider of SaaSOps solutions to manage and secure the digital workplace. With 300+ employees in Atlanta, New York City, and San Francisco, BetterCloud has raised $187 million to date from investors including Warburg Pincus, Bain Capital Ventures, Accel, Greycroft Partners, and Flybridge Capital Partners. David's entire career has been dedicated to improving the modern workplace through innovative, next-generation cloud (SaaS) technology. Previously he held executive positions at Cloud Sherpas (acq. by Accenture) and Vocalocity (acq. by Vonage). David is a long-time contributor to TechCrunch, Mashable, VentureBeat, and Forbes, where he writes about topics like enterprise cloud technology, cloud computing, and entrepreneurship.

name: David Melamed, PhD
title: Founder & CTO
description: Co-Founder & CTO of Jit, I have a Ph.D. in BioInformatics and a long-time experience building complex applications in the cloud. Worked previously at MyHeritage, CloudLock (acquired by Cisco), and Cisco in the CTO Office where I led strategic projects and technical innovation.

name: Eran Etam
title: Founder
description: Eran was a co-founder and the VP R&D of ICQ, the world's first Instant Messenger, which was acquired by AOL for $407M in 1998. After holding a VP position in AOL, Eran served as an R&D advisor at the MoD technology division. Eran started several other Internet startups before co-founding Kaltura on September of 2006. Eran holds a BSc in Mathematics and Computer Science from Tel Aviv University

name: Guy Rinat
title: Founder & COO
description: Guy is a co-founder at Descope. Before Descope, Guy served as VP of Engineering at Palo Alto Networks after the acquisition of Demisto, where he was a co-founder. Prior to Demisto, Guy was VP of R&D at Sentrigo, a database security startup that was acquired by McAfee, where Guy then served as VP of Engineering. Guy’s career spans over two decades and is marked by creating products that customers love, building teams, and nurturing budding security and software leaders.

name: Itamar Falcon
title: Founder & CEO
description: I started my journey in the IDF’s 8200 unit. Following the army I studied CS at the Technion. After my studies, I worked as a product manager as part of the APM programs at Google and Microsoft.

name: Luis Voloch
title: Founder & CTO
description:
Luis Voloch is the co-founder and CTO of Immunai, a company that uses AI to accelerate drug discovery. Before founding Immunai, he studied at MIT, where he earned a degree in mathematics and computer science.

He's passionate about using AI to solve complex problems in biology and healthcare. His goal is to use AI to help develop new treatments for currently incurable diseases. He's a strong believer in the power of collaboration and is excited about the potential for AI to transform the way we approach drug discovery.

name: Sarit Firon
title: Partner
description: Sarit Firon is Managing Partner of Team8 Capital, the new investment vehicle of the Team8 group. One of Israel’s most accomplished investors known for helping to build companies and bring them to IPO and acquisitions, Sarit brings more than 26 years of global investment and operational experience across Silicon Valley, New York, and Tel Aviv. She has held numerous operational and leadership roles, serving as CEO, CFO, Chairperson, and board member at prominent high-tech companies. She served as CFO at MediaMind during its Nasdaq IPO and acquisition by DG Corp for $517M, as well as at P-Cube during its $200M acquisition by Cisco. She also led the seed round of Datorama, taking an active board member role until the company’s$800M acquisition by Salesforce. Prior to joining Team8 Capital, Sarit was Managing Partner of Cerca Partners, which invested in tech companies in the Israeli ecosystem and was part to some of the most notable acquisitions and IPOs including Armis (acquired by Insight Partners for $1.1B), Alooma (acquired by Google), Demisto (acquired by Palo Alto Networks for $560), Dynamic Yield (acquired by McDonalds for $300M) and Fiverr (NYSE: FVRR). Sarit’s experience gives her both exceptional insight and instincts about the viability of a startup, as well as the proven ability to be an active partner in its development and growth. Sarit sits on the board of Shitufim, a social impact non-profit organization.

name: Yochai Levi
title: Founder & CMO
description: Yochai, co-founder and CMO of One AI, previously led marketing at WeWork, Conduit, and Kasamba (acq. by LPSN). He is also an angel investor and advisor in companies and NGOs including NanoRep (acq. by LOGM), Feedvisor, Anodot, nununu, Natural Intelligence, Dendro Neurotech, Healthy.io, and the Computational Neuropsychiatry Lab.

name: Roy Erez
title: Founder & CEO
description: With experience in investing in dozens of startups and co-founding two ventures, Roy now serves as the Founding Partner of R-Squared Ventures, a venture fund guided by a 'founders supporting founders' ethos. Before this role, Roy was the Co-Founder and CEO at Loop Commerce, a company disrupting fintech, retail, and commerce. He started Loop in 2012, raised $30 million from tier-1 industry leaders, scaled it through the acquisition by Synchrony in mid-2018, and continued to run the company as a wholly owned subsidiary as CEO and as a GM and SVP with Synchrony until departing in mid-2020. Roy is passionate about innovation - building and growing great products and businesses. He continues to be engaged in entrepreneurship as an active investor through R-Squared Ventures, a co-founder and board Member, and as an LP and advisor in select funds and companies. He earned his MBA from Columbia Business School and lives in Silicon Valley, California.

name: Ron Sicsic
title: Founder & CSO
description: Ron is the Chief Scientific Officer at Oshi, with a background in Organic Chemistry, Veterinary Medicine, Molecular Biology and Genomics. Formerly a practicing veterinarian, and Co-Founder & Head of R&D at Enviro Advanced Energy, a bio-fuel company.

name: Rishi Bhargava
title: Founder & CBO
description:
Rishi Bhargava is a co-founder at Descope, a developer-first authentication and user management platform. In a career spanning over 20 years, Rishi has run product, strategy, go-to-market, and engineering for category-creating cybersecurity startups and large enterprises. Before Descope, Rishi served as VP of Product Strategy at Palo Alto Networks which he joined via the acquisition of Demisto. Rishi was a co-founder at Demisto where, under his stewardship, the company created and later led a new “security orchestration” category within 3 years before being acquired. Prior to Demisto, Rishi was VP and GM of the Datacenter Group at Intel Security and launched multiple products at McAfee (acquired by Intel).

Rishi is passionate about technology and serves as an active investor and advisor to multiple startups in Silicon Valley and India, some of which have already seen successful exits.

name: Ramon Snir
title: Founder & CTO
description: Ramon Snir has a decade of experience in software engineering, product management, and software architecture. Prior to founding inScreen, Ramon worked at Dynamic Yield for 7 years in various roles including Director of Product & Program Management heading the Quick Service Restaurants group, and at Stackbit as a Senior Software Engineer.

name: Ori Keren
title: Founder & CEO
description: As an ex-VP of Engineering at Cloudlock ($293M exit to Cisco), I discovered there’s no better feeling as an engineering leader than enabling your team to be happy with their work and deliver efficiently with the highest quality. That’s why I co-founded LinearB and serve as its CEO. We want to give organizations the ability to work like this all the time.

name: Or Shoval
title: Founder & CEO
description: Or Shoval is the Co-Founder & CEO of Remepy. Or served as a captain in an elite unit in the Israeli Defense Forces for over six years, overseeing both special field operations as well as new technological development initiatives. In his last position, Or led interdisciplinary teams of elite combat fighters and product developers from technological units. Or holds a bachelor's degree in Liberal Arts and Philosophy from the Shalem College Honors Program in Jerusalem.

name: Ofek Ron
title: Founder & CEO
description: Oshi CEO Ofek Ron was previously the founding board member and VP of Business Development at Vegan-Friendly, an international non-profit organization that aims to end animal suffering and by changing meat consumption towards plant-based food. Prior to Vegan-Friendly, Ofek was the CEO of Software-Sources, one of the largest software distribution houses in Israel. Ofek holds a bachelor's degree in Business & Economics from Reichman's University.

name: Nuseir Yassin
title: Founder & CEO
description:
I grew up as a Palestinian-Israeli. Hated it. Went to Harvard. Graduated. Got a job. Hated it. Started making videos. Loved it.

Currently, I am building Nas Company. Nas means People in Arabic, and our singular focus is to "Bring People Together". We have raised over $23m in funding so far to achieve this mission. Nas.io provides technology tools for Creators to help them build communities, monetize their knowledge, and grow on the Internet. 

We're also lucky to have Nas Daily, which has grown to over 65+ million followers across all social media in 14 languages. Content is an essential piece in building communities.

name: Moti Moravia
title: Founder & CTO
description: Leo AI co-founder & CTO Moti Moravia is both an AI expert and a seasoned Mechanical and System Engineer. With a proven record in the startup industry as Head Architect of AI systems and Data Science Team Leader, and in the Israeli Ministry of Defense as Captain, leading the development of AI algorithms and Mechanical systems for Israel's main battle Tank and infantry fighting vehicles. A co-author of an innovative course on AI in chaotic systems at the Technion. Moti earned his MSc and BSc degrees, Summa Cum Laude, in just four years from Technion's Faculty of Mechanical Engineering. He completed his studies as part of the IDF Intelligence Corps' elite program "Brakim" and has been honored with both the Technion's Award for Academic Excellence and the Brakim program award for Outstanding Academic Achievements.

name: Meitav Harpaz
title: Founder & CEO
description:
I build companies that rely on data engineering to solve complex business challenges in financial services. I strive to build companies and teams that challenge the norms, are highly collaborative, and have an insane motivation to succeed even when the odds are stacked against them. 

I managed product releases across the entire software lifecycle - from concept to sales. I also learned first-hand how to build from the ground up every function in a new organization, by bootstrapping a 100+ people strong business with highly effective marketing, sales, operations, financing and HR functions amongst others. 

I am very particular about quality, experience and value and try to combine them all in a unique company and product to bring to market.

name: Maor Farid
title: Founder & CEO
description: Leo AI CEO Maor Farid is a mechanical engineer with expertise in Applied Mathematics and Artificial Intelligence. Maor did his postdoc in applied math and AI in the Mechanical Engineering Dept of MIT, where he was a Fulbright fellow. He received his Ph.D. at the age of 24 from the Technion and attended Harvard's executive program. Named to Forbes' 30 Under 30 list, Maor served as a mechanical engineer, AI researcher, data scientist, and commander at the Israeli Prime Minister's Office and Unit 8200 - the Israeli Intelligence Corps. Maor is also the founder of the award-winning NGO Learn to Succeed, a winner of the Moskowitz Prize for Zionism for social activity and contribution to the integration of students and youth at risk from the Israeli socioeconomic and geographic periphery.

name: Leonid Belkind
title: Founder & CTO
description: Torq founder and CTO Leonid Belkind previously co-founded and was CTO of Luminate Security, a pioneer in Zero Trust Network Access and Secure Access Services Edge. At Luminate, Leonid guided this enterprise-grade service from inception, to Fortune 500 adoption to acquisition by Symantec. Before Luminate, Leonid managed engineering organizations at CheckPoint Software Technologies that delivered enterprise firewalls and other network, endpoint and data security products.

name: Ilan Graicer
title: Founder & CEO
description: Game Designer and Entrepreneur (among many other things). Founder/co-founder of 4 startups: Impressia, Ontopia, BeInSync (Sold to Phoenix Tech in 2008) and Funtactix online game studio startup (Sold to PlayTech 2015). 30 years experience designing games, websites, CD-ROMS, interactive TV, elearning systems, simulations and digital applications for institutional, private, startups and military projects. Founded GeekCon: Israel's maker movement and annual camps. Cyber Security specialist, ethical hacker and public speaker. Lead in the Israeli red team. Advisor at ICRC - cyber research center in Tel Aviv University on cyber and technology issues.

name: Hila Elimelech
title: Founder
description: Hila is a co-founder and former director of R&D at Oshi. She holds a Ph. D in Materials Chemistry from the Hebrew University and has a decade of experience with Additive Manufacturing (aka 3D printing). Prior to Plantish, Hila served as the focal point for 3D printing in the Israeli Ministry of Defense, where she led the utilization of this technology for the development of novel platforms. Prior to that, she was involved with the foundation of Nano-Dimension, which deals with additive manufacturing of electronics, where she served as VP of materials. Hila has vast experience with executing multi-disciplinary R&D initiatives and executing a concept to realism.

name: Hesky Kutscher
title: Founder & CEO
description:
As the CEO & Co-Founder of Aktivate, I am passionate about revolutionizing the scholastic sports management landscape. With a focus on digital transformation, our platform empowers athletic departments and schools to streamline their programs, benefiting student athletes and their families.

Drawing upon my extensive experience as an entrepreneur, I have successfully navigated the realms of VC fundraising and bootstrapping. Prior to Aktivate, I played a significant role in the success of CareDox, where we transformed from a B2C company into the nation's leading digital health platform for K-12 public schools. This experience has provided me with invaluable insights and a deep understanding of the intersection between technology, healthcare, and education.

At Aktivate, I am dedicated to driving growth, overseeing business development efforts, and building high-performing organizations. Through strategic partnerships and innovative solutions, we are reshaping how schools manage their athletic programs and empowering student athletes to take control of their athletic journey.

With a specialization in sales and a proven track record in organizational development, I am committed to creating an impactful and sustainable future for Aktivate. Let's connect and explore how we can leverage technology to transform the scholastic sports industry and unlock the full potential of student athletes.

name: Eldad Livni
title: Founder & CPO
description: Eldad Livni is an experienced R&D, product, business, and corporate development executive. He currently leads StackPulse product development. Prior to co-founding StackPulse, Eldad co-founded Luminate Security (acquired by Symantec) and, prior to that, worked more than a decade for Check Point Software Technologies, where he was responsible for developing enterprise-grade products.

name: Elad Shoushan
title: Founder & CPO
description:
4x entrepreneur; product executive at Fortune 100; passionate about tackling massive problems with digital products and technology. Founded, led, and scaled startup companies. Invested in, advised, and coached amazing Founders/CEOs. Incepted over 40 products in cyber security, medical devices, education, quick commerce, fulfillment, and fintech. I was fortunate to build 28 mobile apps that achieved the top 5 position in Education as well as Food & Beverages categories at Apple’s AppStore and Google PlayStore worldwide. My apps have been used by 20M+ consumers, generated tens of millions of dollars, and have been featured over 2,000 times as the best apps in their respective categories. 
Aside from that, I love spending time with my three amazing kids. And as a fun fact - a long time ago I played basketball professionally in Israel.

name: Efi Cohen
title: Founder & CTO
description: Efi Cohen is Head of Salesforce Israel R&D Centre and SVP, Product and Engineering at Datorama, a Salesforce company, and most recently, was Co-Founder and CTO of Datorama which was acquired by Salesforce in 2018. Efi has been building and managing industry-leading products and teams for the past 21 years. Prior to founding Datorama in 2012, Efi was part of the founding team (employee number one) of Eyeblaster (MediaMind / Sizmek) where he led and built the architecture and technology as VP Technology. MediaMind went public (NASDAQ) in 2010 and got acquired by DG Inc in 2011.

name: Dror Feldheim
title: Founder & President
description: Dror Feldheim is a co-founder and the Chief Commercial Officer (CCO) at Trax. Dror is responsible for Trax’s global sales management, distribution channel management, marketing communications, pricing and customer service. Before being named CCO in Jan 2015, Dror was Trax’s VP of Global Sales and Business Development, where he oversaw negotiations, joint ventures and partnerships that complement Trax’s long-term vision and strategy. Prior to joining Trax, Dror has had over 15 years of business development experience within the FMCG sector. With proven track record of successfully launching FMCG brands in diverse geographies, he has managed various categories for tier-one manufacturers and distributors across both emerging and developed markets. Dror has a strong background in customer success and category leadership, constantly seeking innovative ways to meet both customer and business needs.

name: Daniel Ramot
title: Founder & CEO
description: Daniel is the co-founder and CEO of mobility unicorn Via, and an advisor to the TechAviv Founder Partners fund.

name: Dan Sarel
title: Founder & VP Product
description: Dan is the Chief Product Officer and co-founder at Descope. Dan’s career spans over 2 decades where he started as a Sales Engineer in a network security company and continued to hold various senior PM positions in companies such as Check Point, Sentrigo and McAfee. Prior to Descope, Dan was VP Product at Palo Alto Networks after the acquisition of Demisto, where he was co-founder and VP Product.

name: Barr Yaron
title: Principle
description:
Barr Yaron is the founder of Women of Startup Nation, an organization devoted to advancing Israeli women in technology and entrepreneurship. She is also a technologist, early stage investor, and Sequoia scout. Barr grew up in the United States to two Israeli parents. After interning in a wide range of industries, from the White House to Wall Street to Beyonce’s digital team, she was drawn to technology for its fast pace of change and potential to move society forward. She always wanted to live in Israel and relocated from Silicon Valley to Tel Aviv in 2016 through her work as a data scientist at Facebook. In late 2016 she founded Women of Startup Nation, an online page dedicated to the incredible achievements and stories of Israeli women in tech. She has interviewed over 150 Israeli women in technology and shared their stories, growing the platform to 20K+ followers. This platform has partnered with organizations around the country to help them increase female applicant pipelines.
 
In summer 2019, Barr expanded Women of Startup Nation to co-found Women of Startup Nation Accelerator, a full-time program in partnership with Google for Startups with the goal of accelerating the success of female-founded startups. Outside of Women of Startup Nation, Barr works in product management, as an angel investor, and as a founding General Partner of a fund for startups coming from her Stanford class. She graduated with her B.A. in Applied Mathematics, Economics and Computer Science from Harvard College as a John Harvard Scholar and her MBA from Stanford Graduate School of Business as an Arjay Miller Scholar.

name: Aviv Dror
title: Founder & CPO
description: One AI CPO Aviv Dror is an experienced startup leader and product Leader. Prior to co-founding One AI Aviv co-founded Nanorep which was acquired by LogMeIn.

name: Avi Simon
title: Founder & CTO
description: Previously Chief Data Officer of the Israel Defense Forces, overseeing the IDF’s R&D in the areas of software, data, and artificial intelligence. Also served as the CIO and CTO of the Israeli intelligence corps and commanded numerous R&D units. Experienced R&D manager in the fields of artificial intelligence, data science, computer vision, software development, and information technology. Hold an MSc and BSc in Systems and Electrical engineering, both from the Technion. Passionate about people, organizations, and digital transformation via disruptive technologies.

name: Asi Shefer
title: Founder & CSO
description: My life quest is to understand the interaction between reality and the mind. In my journey, I've developed novel approaches that mimic human cognitive systems in linguistics, generalization, and multi-domain learning. My years in the academy and industry working with enterprises like IBM and LogMeIn, as well as startups, fueled One AI’s vision - to build human-inspired AI for everyone.

name: Amit Regev
title: Founder & CPO
description: Flytrex CPO and co-founder Amit Regev is making drone delivery a reality. He os a seasoned founder and product manager with over 20 years of proven experience in product development, execution of vision, and introducing innovative products to new markets. Prior to Flytrex Amir co-founded SeaSide Software (acquired by M-Systems) and was the founder of a mobile apps company in the Palm/Pocket PC era, bringing it to 0.5M paying customers and a top 10 leading app companies. He started his first business at age 14, selling return-to-school books online back in 1996.

name: Amit Ben
title: Founder & CEO
description: With vast experience in building AI organizations and developing AI strategy and execution, Amit's true passion is in bringing novel solutions to market through innovation and through leadership. Amit was previously Head of AI at LogMeIn (Acquired by Francisco Partners), CTO and Founder at NanoRep (acquired by Nasdaq: LOGM) and CTO and Founder at ActiveRoom Technologies.

name: Alan Feld
title: Founder and Managing Partner
description:
Alan Feld is the Founder and Managing Partner of Vintage Investment Partners. Vintage Investment Partners is Israel’s leading venture fund of funds, secondary fund and late stage co-investment team. The firm today manages $2.3 billion through 13 funds and a managed account. Vintage tracks over 500 venture funds and more than 7,500 private technology companies.Prior to founding Vintage in 2002, Alan Feld was a general partner at Israel Seed Partners and at Vertex Ventures. Prior to Vertex, Alan was the Managing Director of Evergreen Capital Markets/Robertson Stephens Israel. Before moving to Israel in 1994, Alan was at Goodman’s (Toronto), one of Canada’s leading corporate law firms.

Alan is the Founding Chairman of the PowerInDiversityIsrael Initiative ([www.powerindiversityisrael.com](http://www.powerindiversityisrael.com/)), focused on bringing more women and minorities into the Israeli high tech industry. He was also Founding Chairman of StartUp Jerusalem, a non-profit organization run by Israeli and Palestinian businesspeople helping to foster job growth in Jerusalem. He served as Chairman of the Steering Committee of the Be’eri project, an initiative of the Hartman Institute, and is also a former board member of the Israel Democracy Institute and the Jewish Funders Network (US). Alan also served as Associate Chairman of the Canadian Jewish Congress, President of the North American Jewish Students Network and a board member of the Canada Israel Committee and Kolot (Jerusalem), a pluralistic adult Jewish education program. Alan received an MBA from York University in Toronto, an L.L.B. from Osgoode Hall Law School in Toronto and a B.A. in Commerce and Finance from the University of Toronto.

name: Alex Sirota
title: Founder & CTO
description: Alex is an entrepreneur with over 20 years of experience in building companies, products, and teams. He is also an angel investor, advisor to startup companies, and a published author. After heading a computer unit in the Israeli military, Alex started his first company, Elbrus, in 1997. In 2005, he co-founded FoxyTunes, which developed the world’s most popular music browser add-on. After FoxyTunes was acquired by Yahoo! in 2008, Alex spent over four years as Yahoo!’s Head of Media Web Apps, running multiple high-profile projects, products and initiatives. In 2012 Alex co-founded Loop Commerce, where he was Chief Product & Technology Officer. Loop Commerce is disrupting fin-tech, retail and commerce with its patented, award-winning GiftNow® technology and service. Loop Commerce was acquired by Synchrony (SYF) in 2018.

name: Yuval Tal
title: Founder & President
description: Yuval Tal is a Managing Partner of Team8 Fintech and an advisor to the TechAviv fund. Previously, he founded and is the former President and Board Member of Payoneer, one of Israel’s first fintech unicorn companies. Before founding and running Payoneer from 2005 until 2011, Yuval co-founded Borderfree (NASDAQ: BRDR), and was its CEO from 1999-2005. Borderfree provides services that expedite cross-border ecommerce and payments for many large online and offline retailers. Yuval served previously as the Vice President of business development for Radware (NASDAQ: RDWR). He is a member of YPO and is an angel investor in several start-ups in the payment space. Yuval is a member of Harvard Business School plan for managers.

name: Yoni Assia
title: Founder & CEO
description: Yoni Assia is an Israeli entrepreneur and the founder and CEO of eToro, a social investment network. Before starting eToro, he was the co-founder of CDRide, an on-ride video technology company. He has always been passionate about computers and coding, and this led him to start several successful businesses.

name: Yaron Samid
title: Founder & Managing Partner
description: Yaron Samid is an Israeli-American technology entrepreneur, investor, and startup community builder. Yaron is the founder of TechAviv, the 3K-member global Israeli founders club, and the Managing Partner of TechAviv Founder Partners, its pre-seed venture fund. Previously, Yaron was founder & CEO at BillGuard (Acq. by Prosper), founder & CPO at Pando (Acq. by Microsoft), and a founding board director at CloudLock (Acq. by Cisco) and Pond5 (Acq. by Shutterstock). Yaron lives in Ramat Hasharon, Israel, and is a regular guest lecturer at Stanford and Columbia business schools.

name: Yael Vizel
title: Founder & CEO
description:
Yael Vizel is an entrepreneur and innovator who is best known for founding Zeekit, a company that uses AI to help people find clothes that fit them perfectly. Walmart acquired Zeekit in May of 2021. 

Born and raised in Ramat Gan, Israel, Vizel was never particularly interested in fashion, but she saw an opportunity to use technology to solve a problem that many people face - finding clothes that fit well and look good.

name: Yaron Galai
title: Founder & CEO
description:
Yaron Galai is the Co-Founder and Co-CEO at Outbrain. 

Prior to founding Outbrain, Galai was Co-Founder of Quigo, Inc., which invented the space of Contextual Advertising. Quigo was acquired by AOL in 2007.

Galai was also Co-Founder of Ad4ever, an adtech company which was acquired by Atlas, a division of aQuantive, and was on the Board of Directors of HopStop, a mapping technology company which was acquired by Apple.

name: Yariv Bash
title: Founder & CEO
description: Yariv is the co-founder and CEO of Flytrex Aviation. Flytrex is building the Fedex of autonomous aerial delivery and are one of only three drone companies being approved by the FAA to deliver packages to residential houses in the US. Flytrex has signed deals with Walmart and others as their "drone delivery as a service" provider, focusing initially on consumer goods and food. Prior to Flytrex, Yariv founded SpaceIL, a $100M mission that made history sending the 1st private unmanned spacecraft to the moon.

name: Udi Mokady
title: Founder & CEO
description:
Udi Mokady is the Chairman and CEO of CyberArk (NASDAQ: CYBR), and a pioneer in establishing the Privileged Access Management software market. Since co-founding the company in 1999, Mokady has entrenched CyberArk as the market leader. During his tenure at CyberArk, Mokady has also served as CyberArk’s chief strategist and visionary, overseeing global expansion, management, execution and corporate development. 



Since assuming the position of CEO in 2005, Mokady’s leadership and direction has been instrumental in guiding CyberArk to achieve record growth, while accelerating overall market adoption for privileged access management solutions to protect against an evolving advanced threat landscape. Mokady was elected Chairman of the Board in 2016



Mokady received the 2018 Asper Award for Global Entrepreneurship from Brandeis University and a 2017 SC Media Reboot Award as a cyber security influencer. He was named the 2014 Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year for the Technology Security category in New England. Mokady is a member of the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) Cyber Security Advisory Panel and the Brandeis International Business School Board of Advisors. He was previously a member of the Demisto Board of Directors, prior to its acquisition by Palo Alto Networks in March 2019.

name: Tomer Tagrin
title: Founder & CEO
description: Tomer Tagrin is the Co-founder and CEO at Yotpo a MarketingTech unicorn. Yotpo is a customer content marketing platform that helps businesses generate customer reviews and transform them into a powerful marketing engine.

name: Tomer Weingarten
title: Founder & CEO
description: Tomer co-founded SentinelOne in 2013. He is responsible for the company’s direction, products, and services strategy. Before SentinelOne, Tomer led product development and strategy for the Toluna Group as a VP of Products. Prior to that he held several application security and consulting roles at various enterprises, and was CTO at Carambola Media.

name: Tomer Shiran
title: Founder & CPO
description: Tomer Shiran is Founder & CPO of Dremio, the cloud data lake company. As the founding CEO, he grew the company to 100 employees and raised over $100 million. Prior to Dremio, he was VP Product and 5th employee at MapR. As a member of the executive team, Tomer helped grow the company to over 300 employees and 700 enterprise customers. Prior to MapR, Tomer held numerous product management and engineering positions at Microsoft and IBM Research. He holds a master's degree in electrical and computer engineering from Carnegie Mellon University and a bachelor’s in computer science from Technion - Israel Institute of Technology, as well as five U.S. patents.

name: Tomer London
title: Founder & CPO
description: Tomer is the co-founder and Chief Product Officer of Gusto a multi-billion dollar HRTech company headquartered in San Francisco. He is responsible for the development and execution of the product vision — reimagining how modern payroll, benefits, and compliance should operate.

name: Shlomi Ben Haim
title: Founder & CEO
description: Shlomi Ben-Haim is an Israeli entrepreneur and business leader who is best known for co-founding JFrog, a software company that provides solutions for managing and distributing software updates. Before starting JFrog, Ben-Haim was the CEO of AlphaCSP, a company he co-founded, which was later acquired in 2005.

name: Tomer Bar-Zeev
title: Founder & CEO
description: Tomer Bar Zeev is the CEO and co-founder of ironSource and an advisor to the TechAviv fund. Overseeing the ironSource's growth from day one, Tomer is passionate about making the company truly global, spearheading the company’s international growth and establishing offices on 5 continents. Prior to founding ironSource, Tomer held VP positions at Payoneer and Atlas CT. Born in Israel, Tomer spent 9 years living in Peru as a child before returning to study computer science at the IDC. Originally a developer of popular consumer software products, Tomer’s experience as a programmer was pivotal in giving him an intimate understanding of what developers need to turn great products into successful businesses, and that focus still drives him today. Tomer is a member of the Young Entrepreneurs Council, sits on the board of the IATI, and has been named one of the 100 Most Intriguing Entrepreneurs by Goldman Sachs. He is also an active investor in other technology startups.

name: Shay Banon
title: Founder & CEO
description: Shay is founder and CEO at Elastic (NASDAQ: ESTC) and advisor to the TechAviv fund. Shay is fascinated with search ever since he tried to build a recipe app for his wife in 2004, a journey that led to him writing the first few lines of code for Elasticsearch in 2009 and later founding Elastic in 2012. Elastic went public in 2018 and is valued at over $11B as of Dec 2020. Shay believes finding beauty and excelling is a combination of perspective and grit. As someone who got into computers by counting the number of job postings in the newspaper, he loves building things - a product, a community, or a company - and the process of acquiring the knowledge to do so.

name: Slavik Markovich
title: Founder & CEO
description: Slavik is the CEO and co-founder at Descope. A serial entrepreneur, Slavik is passionate about solving hard technology problems. Before Descope, Slavik was co-founder and CEO at Demisto, a leader in the SOAR industry that was acquired by Palo Alto Networks, where he then served as SVP Products. Prior to co-founding Demisto, Slavik was VP & CTO of database technologies at McAfee (Intel Security). He joined McAfee via the acquisition of Sentrigo, a database security startup, where he was a co-founder and served as CTO. Slavik is an investor in dozens of startups and serves as a board member and advisor to several security startups as well.

name: Sarah Tavel
title: Partner
description: Sarah invests in network effect businesses with a particular focus on AI, marketplaces & social. Prior to Benchmark, Sarah was a Partner at Greylock Partners, where she led Greylock's investment in Sonder and Gixo. Before Greylock, Sarah was the product lead for search, recommendations, machine vision, and pin quality at Pinterest.

name: Shalom McKenzie
title: Founder
description: Shalom is the founder of amp, the next evolution of interactive fitness. He is also the founder, CEO and Chairman of SBTech which merged with Draft Kings before its IPO.

name: Saul Klein
title: Partner
description: In 2019, Saul Klein expanded the investing work he's been doing since leaving Index Ventures in 2015 by co-founding Latitude Ventures, a sister fund to the firm he runs with his father Robin (No. 9), LocalGlobe. LocalGlobe's early-stage investments include Improbable (valued at $2 billion), Citymapper, Graze, Moo, Secret Escapes, Tessian, TransferWise (valued at $3.5 billion), and Zoopla (acquired for about $3 billion). With Latitude, Klein plans to invest in later-stage opportunities form LocalGlobe's portfolio and network as a sister fund. Klein previously co-founded a range of startups, was on the original leadership team at Skype, and served as the first chief privacy officer at Microsoft after selling them a startup in 1997.https://twitter.com/cape

name: Scott Tobin
title: Partner
description:
Scott joined Battery in 1997. Based in Battery’s Israel office, he leads investments in the U.S., Israel and Europe. His current portfolio companies include 8fig, Affirm (NASDAQ: AFRM), Array, BigPanda, Champions Oncology (NASDAQ: CSBR), Cheq, Code Ocean, Cross River Bank, HiBob, Higlobe, Istra Research, Kodiak, Lightbox, LinearB, Nexite, Next Insurance, NorthOne, Novidea, Olo (NYSE: OLO), Sofar Sounds, Taster, UBQ Materials, Vayyar Imaging and Xsight Labs.
Scott’s previous investments include Akamai Technologies (NASDAQ: AKAM); Anobit Technologies (acquired by Apple); Cortera; Credifi; Cumulus Networks (acquired by NVIDIA); Diablo Technologies; GuardiCore (acquired by Akamai), Habana Labs (acquired by Intel); IDI Direct Insurance (TASE: IDIN); ITA Software (acquired by Google); Jeeng (acquired by Openweb); The London International Financial Futures and Options Exchange (LIFFE; acquired by Euronext); MetroPCS (NYSE: PCS); Pursway (acquired by IPG); Sabre (NASDAQ: SABR); Stratoscale; Tennis Channel (acquired by Sinclair Broadcasting); and Zerto (acquired by Hewlett Packard Enterprise).
Scott was named multiple times to the Forbes Midas List and the Forbes Midas List Europe, which ranks top venture capitalists. Scott is involved in a number of social-impact initiatives. He proudly serves on the board of directors of Maoz, an organization that brings together a network of the best and brightest public-sector leaders in Israel to collaborate on tangible initiatives to transform the Israeli public sphere. Scott graduated with honors from Brandeis University with a BA in international relations and Islamic and Middle Eastern Studies.

name: Shay David
title: Founder & CEO
description: Retrain founder and CEO Shay David was previously the co-founder of the enterprise video unicorn, Kaltura. He led strategy, marketing, sales and partnerships from inception to exponential growth. Prior to Kaltura, Shay was a co-founder in Destinator technologies, a leader in mobile GPS navigation software. Shay holds a B.Sc. in Computer Science and a B.A. in Philosophy, (Magna Cum Laude), from Tel-Aviv University, an M.A. from New York University, a PhD from Cornell University and Post-doc from Yale Law School.

name: Saar Yoskovitz
title: Founder & CEO
description: Saar Yoskovitz is Co-Founder and CEO at Augury - a Digital Machine Health company building a future where people can always rely on the machines that matter. Since co-founding Augury in 2011 he has been working with customers and partners to transform how they work to make products, deliver services and improve lives through real-time insight into the health and performance of industrial equipment and systems. Saar holds a dual bachelor's degree in electrical engineering and physics from the Technion, the Israel Institute of Technology. Before launching Augury, Saar worked at Intel as an Analog Architect in the CPU division.

name: Saar Wilf
title: Founder & CEO
description: Serial entrepreneur. Founded Fraud Sciences (acquired by PayPal), ClarityRay (acquired by Yahoo), Trivnet (acquired by Gemalto). First investor in Moon Active (valued at $1.25 billion), Supersonic (acquired by Iron Source), Crosswise (acquired by Oracle). Interests: Probability, Machine Learning, Payments, Computer Vision, Optics

name: Sagie Davidovich
title: Founder & CEO
description: Sagie is an entrepreneur, technological visionary, and machine intelligence enthusiast. Striving to bridge the gap between human & machine reasoning and interaction. Sagie devotes his spare time to advising exciting start-up companies and sharing his thoughts on www.singularityworld.com. For the past 17 years, busy solving exciting challenges, while creating new ones in the spare time. Passionate about computational knowledge representation, acquisition, storage, reasoning, and processing. Sagie has been lucky to serve in executive technological positions in disruptive start-up companies. Prior to co-founding SparkBeyond, Sergey served as GM and SVP of R&D, newBrandAnalytics, a social business intelligence pioneer, Prior to newBrandAnalytics, Sagie served as VP R&D of SemantiNet, a semantic reasoning engine. Prior to Semantinet, Sagie co-founded Delver, a social search engine (acquired by sears), where he served as CTO. Prior to founding Delver, Sagie was the architect of a large scale award-winning predictive maintenance system.

name: Roy Rubin
title: Founder & CEO
description: Roy Rubin is the co-founder and former CEO of Magento. Launched in 2008, the open source Magento eCommerce platform has been enthusiastically embraced by developers and 250,000 merchants, transacting $100B+ annually. A technologist at heart, Roy’s vision and strategic acumen helped him build a thriving business and ecosystem around the platform. In August, 2011, Magento was acquired by eBay, Inc., where Roy became a vice president. He continued to lead the Magento business until his departure from eBay in May, 2014. Roy remains actively interested in commerce technology, and has invested in young companies including Loop Commerce, AnyRoad and TaxJar among others.

name: Shai Wininger
title: Founder & CEO
description: Shai Wininger is an accomplished tech entrepreneur and inventor, best known for co-founding Lemonade, a peer-to-peer insurance company, and Fiverr, a marketplace for digital services. He has a passion for using technology to solve problems and improve people's lives. Shai is a strong believer in the power of innovation and collaboration, and is always looking for new ways to make a positive impact.

name: Ruvi Kitov
title: Founder & CEO
description: Ruvi Kitov is the Co-Founder and former CEO of Tufin, the Security Policy Company (NYSE: TUFN). Ruvi led the company since Tufin’s founding in 2005, gaining more than 2,000 customers among the world’s largest enterprises. Prior to Tufin he served in key project management and development roles at Check Point Software.

name: Roy Raanani
title: Founder & CEO
description:
Founder / CEO of Chorus.ai. Expertise in business application of AI/ML, category creation, B2B SaaS, initial and scaling go-to-market, company building and M&A. Chorus.ai was sold to ZoomInfo for $575M. I consider myself a generalist with broad, but non-expert, technical understanding in a wide range of technical fields (e.g., chemistry, fluid mechanics, quantum physics, thermodynamics, signal analysis). My strengths are understanding complex and connected systems that intersect multiple domains. I spent 8 years at Bain & Company advising Fortune 500 businesses on operations and strategy on projects ranging from improving mill extraction in Alaskan gold mines to reducing manufacturing complexity in semiconductors.

I was the first hire at Innovation Endeavors 2009-2010 and am like to get deeply involved in a small number of early stage companies that want to have a significant impact on global GDP. I hold a Bachelor of Applied Science, Engineering Science from the University of Toronto and MBA from the Stanford Graduate School of Business.

name: Ron Yekutiel
title: Founder & CEO
description: Ron has over 15 years of senior management experience in the security and defense, systems (hardware-software) development, mobile & wireless, and Internet spaces. Instrumental in creating new businesses, developing and launching industry leading products and technologies, planning and executing high growth business plans, and building worldwide distribution channels and strategic partnerships. Founder and CEO of several companies across the US, Canada, and Israel as well as founding director of several non profit organizations. Specialties: Founding startups, product development, high growth business plans, business development, worldwide sales and marketing, distribution & OEM agreements.

name: Roy Mann
title: Founder & CEO
description: Roy Mann is an Israeli entrepreneur who founded Monday.com, a work management platform that helps teams collaborate and get things done. Prior to founding Monday.com, Roy was the CTO of Wix.com, a website building platform. He's a self-taught programmer and has a passion for building products that make people's lives easier.

name: Micha Kaufman
title: Founder & CEO
description: Micha Kaufman is a visionary entrepreneur and thought leader who has made significant contributions to the digital services and freelance economy. As the co-founder and CEO of Fiverr, the world's largest marketplace for digital services, Kaufman has revolutionized the gig economy by creating a platform that enables people to buy and sell a wide variety of digital services from all corners of the globe. His innovative approach and dedication to improving access to freelance work have fostered economic opportunities for millions of people worldwide. Beyond Fiverr, Kaufman's expertise spans entrepreneurship, e-commerce, and digital marketing, often sharing his insights as a keynote speaker at industry events. With his impressive track record and forward-thinking vision, Kaufman continues to shape the future of work in the digital age.

name: Nadav Shoval
title: Founder & CEO
description: Nadav Shoval is a serial entrepreneur who has founded multiple companies, but OpenWeb is his most well-known venture. OpenWeb is a content moderation platform that helps publishers and websites to manage their online communities. It's used by some of the biggest names in media, including The New York Times and CNN.

name: Ronni Zehavi
title: Founder & CEO
description:
Ronni Zehavi is the founder and CEO of hibob, a company that provides HR software for small and medium-sized businesses. He founded hibob in 2015, and has since grown the company to become a leading player in the HR software space.

Prior to founding hibob, he was the CEO of Singular, a marketing analytics company. He has a strong background in technology and entrepreneurship, and is passionate about helping businesses to grow and succeed. Does that sound like a good summary?

name: Meirav Oren
title: Founder & CEO
description: As CEO and co-founder of Versatile, Meirav is a visionary leader who brings passion, collaboration, and a never-quit attitude to everything she does. Before co-founding Versatile, she spent 10 years at Intel, spearheading BizOps and financial services, leading international projects with multicultural teams. She leads the Tel Aviv chapter of the Society for Construction Solutions (SCS). Under her leadership, Versatile became the first construction technology firm named a Technology Pioneer by the World Economic Forum. Meirav holds multiple degrees, including an Executive MBA, LL.M, and a BA in Economics & Business Management, and is a former Lieutenant of the Israeli Air Force.

name: Mickey Boodaei
title: Founder & CEO
description: Mickey is a cybersecurity entrepreneur and product strategist with over 25 years of experience in cybersecurity. In 2002, Mickey co-founded Imperva (IMPV), the leader in Web and database security. In 2007, Mickey founded Trusteer, a fraud prevention company that was acquired by IBM in 2013. Mickey has made early investments in successful cybersecurity companies including Armis, Aorato (now part of Microsoft), Hyperwise and Lacoon (now part of Check Point), FireGlass (now part of Symantec), and others.

name: Matan Bar
title: Founder & CEO
description: Matan Bar is the co-founder and CEO of Melio – an accounts payable solution designed for small US businesses. Before starting Melio, Matan was the GM of the PayPal Consumer R&D center in Tel Aviv and led PayPal’s Consumer Peer to Peer Payments Group globally, responsible for over $50B in payment volume annually. Matan joined PayPal through an acquisition of his first company that he co-founded back in 2009 and got acquired by eBay Inc in 2012.

name: Max August
title: Investor
description:
Max August is an investment professional at General Atlantic, a leading global growth equity firm with $40B AUM, where he focuses exclusively on Israel. Prior to GA, Max spent 2 years serving as one of Dan Senor and Saul Singer’s research associates for their follow-up book to Start-Up Nation. He also spent time at RRE Ventures, an early-stage venture capital fund in New York, and at Torch Partners, a tech-focused investment bank in London. In addition, Max worked at Visa’s Innovation Studio in Tel Aviv, focused on FinTech investing. Max studied Economics at Harvard College and published his senior thesis about the Impact of Experience on Israeli Entrepreneurial Success, a project co-advised by Larry Summers and Paul Gompers.

Max is deeply involved in Jewish and Israel non-profit work. While at Harvard, he started the Israel Summit, a grassroots movement dedicated to helping college students engage with Israel. To date, the Israel Summit movement has raised over $500K, spread to 5 campuses, and hosted 40+ high-tech Israeli startups along with many distinguished speakers. He is also a board member of the Jewish Future Pledge, a new initiative seeking to encourage Jewish engagement across generations. Max currently lives in New York and has a profound love of ping-pong.

name: Lilach Bar David
title: Founder & CEO
description:
Lilach Bar David is the co-founder and CEO of Lili, a banking platform for small business owners. She's an experienced fintech executive with over 10 years of experience in the industry.

Before founding Lili, she was involved in several other fintech ventures. She's passionate about using technology to make financial services more accessible and user-friendly for small businesses.

name: Liad Agmon
title: Partner
description: Liad is a serial entrepreneur with rich experience as a startup founder and as a Fortune 500 executive. Prior to founding and selling Dynamic Yield for $300M, he founded information security vendor Onigma (acquired by McAfee) and social search company Delver (acquired by Sears Holdings).
